title: Faculty Forum Online: A Conversation with Noam Chomsky
description:
Institute Professor Emeritus Noam Chomsky, a prolific author, political activist, and philosopher, is one of MIT’s greatest scientists. He created the field of modern linguistics—the scientific study of language—and his political commentaries have sparked controversy and conversation for more than 50 years.
 
In this January 2015 Faculty Forum Online webcast, Chomsky discussed his career, answered live questions, and discussed the Chomsky Archive, an MIT Libraries project to preserve and digitize the lectures, personal papers, and materials he has donated to MIT.
